title: Take Screenshots Quickly
description: Press Win+Shift+S to open the snipping tool in Windows 10/11.
longDescription: Learn how to take screenshots quickly and efficiently in Windows 10 and 11 using the built-in Snipping Tool.
steps: Your screen will dim and a toolbar will appear at the top
Choose your snipping mode: Rectangular, Freeform, Window, or Fullscreen
Select the area you want to capture
The screenshot is automatically copied to your clipboard
Click the notification to open it in Snip & Sketch for editing
additionalTips: Use Win+PrtScn to save a fullscreen screenshot directly to Pictures folder
Alt+PrtScn captures only the active window
You can access Snipping Tool settings from the system tray icon

title: Incognito Mode Shortcut
description: Press Ctrl+Shift+N in Chrome to open a new Incognito window.
longDescription: Open an Incognito or Private browsing window instantly using keyboard shortcuts across different browsers.
benefits: Websites can't track you with cookies
Sign in to multiple accounts simultaneously
